events.text:
I step out of the room room in an instant.
The halls of the building are empty. 
Sally wasn't in her shop.
The group of youths had disappeared from the steps of the building.
Apple had left.

It was always going to end this way. 
My father didn't prepare me for the world, thinking all you need was patriotism and a will to protect what he deemed as "goodness". 
I never knew anything else. 
My entire belief-system was shaped by my father and the silly anime I used to watch as a child.
The hero must get to the top! [br][br]Be the very best!
You have to be the best or you are a side-character.
You have to save the world for your story to take place in.
That's what I thought.
The main character. 
I wanted to be the main character in our story. 
I wanted to hold your hand, to grow old, to see the starry sky unburdened by the clouds of wartime.
But the times were what they were. 
They were what they were.

Under the protection of the sprout’s shadow, my gaze moved heavenward. 
Perhaps it will grow into the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
Perhaps it will grow into the tree of life.
Perhaps they are one and the same.

The sky above. [pause=1]The land below. 
Where, o where, will our desires guide us hereinafter.
– End
